t: 1 Chronicles 27
The Military Divisions

And*p the children of Israel, according to their number, the heads of fathers’ houses,*i the captains of thousands and hundreds and their officers, served the king in every matter of the military*i divisions. These*i divisions*i came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year, each division having*i twenty-four thousand.
Over*p the first division for the first month was*i Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel, and in his division were*i twenty-four thousand;
he*i was*i of the children of Perez, and the chief of all the captains of the army for the first month.
Over the division of the second month was*i Dodai an Ahohite, and of his division Mikloth also was*i the leader; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
The third captain of the army for the third month was*i Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the priest, who was chief; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
This was the Benaiah who*i was*i mighty among*i the thirty, and was over the thirty; in his division was*i Ammizabad his son.
The fourth captain*i for the fourth month was*i Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
The fifth captain for the fifth month was*i Shamhuth the Izrahite; in his division were twenty-four thousand.
The sixth captain*i for the sixth month was*i Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
The seventh captain*i for the seventh month was*i Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
The eighth captain*i for the eighth month was*i Sibbechai the Hushathite, of the Zarhites; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
The ninth captain*i for the ninth month was*i Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
The tenth captain*i for the tenth month was*i Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zarhites; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
The eleventh captain*i for the eleventh month was*i Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
The twelfth captain*i for the twelfth month was*i Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel; in his division were*i twenty-four thousand.
Leaders of Tribes
Furthermore,*p over the tribes of Israel: the officer over the Reubenites was*i Eliezer the son of Zichri; over the Simeonites, Shephatiah the son of Maachah;
over*i the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel; over the Aaronites, Zadok;
over*i Judah, Elihu, one*i of David’s brothers; over*i Issachar, Omri the son of Michael;
over*i Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah; over*i Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel;
over*i the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah; over*i the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah;
over*i the half– tribe*i of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah; over*i Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner;
over*i Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were*i the leaders of the tribes of Israel.
But*p David did not take the number of those twenty years old and under, because the Lord*s had said He would multiply Israel like the stars of the heavens.
Joab the son of Zeruiah began a census, but he did not finish, for wrath came upon Israel because of this census; nor was the number recorded in the account of the chronicles of King David.
Other State Officials
And*p Azmaveth the son of Adiel was*i over the king’s treasuries; and Jehonathan the son of Uzziah was over the storehouses in the field, in the cities, in the villages, and in the fortresses.
Ezri the son of Chelub was over those who did the work of the field for tilling the ground.
And Shimei the Ramathite was*i over the vineyards, and Zabdi the Shiphmite was over the produce of the vineyards for the supply of wine.
Baal-Hanan the Gederite was over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were*i in the lowlands, and Joash was*i over the store of oil.
And Shitrai the Sharonite was*i over the herds that fed in Sharon, and Shaphat the son of Adlai was over the herds that*i were*i in the valleys.
Obil the Ishmaelite was*i over the camels, Jehdeiah the Meronothite was*i over the donkeys,
and Jaziz the Hagrite was*i over the flocks. All these were*i the officials over King David’s property.
Also*p Jehonathan, David’s uncle, was*i a counselor, a wise man, and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni was*i with the king’s sons.
Ahithophel was*i the king’s counselor, and Hushai the Archite was*i the king’s companion.
After Ahithophel was*i Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, then Abiathar. And the general of the king’s army was*i Joab.
